title: Semantic Directive Enhancement
description: Core philosophy and architectural principles for the modern Angular CDK.
content:
1. **Semantic HTML First** - Enhance native elements (`<button>`, `<dialog>`) with directives instead of wrapping them in custom components.
2. **Platform over Polyfill** - Replace complex JavaScript logic with native CSS features like Anchor Positioning, Popover API, and `inert` attribute.
3. **Signal-Native Architecture** - Utilize signals for state and zoneless change detection to minimize bundle size and improve performance.
4. **Structural Selectors** - Leverage CSS nesting and structural selectors (e.g., `:host > header`) to eliminate class-based styling "soup."

title: Modular & Buildable Architecture
description: Complete workspace structure for building a semantic HTML-first component library.
content:
1. **Modular Library Isolation** - Organize code into discrete, buildable libraries (core, tokens, primitives, forms, layout) to ensure clear boundaries and fast builds.
2. **Modern Defaults** - Standardize on standalone APIs, esbuild, and zoneless Angular from the start.
3. **Progressive Enhancement** - Use core feature detection to provide modern CSS-first implementations while maintaining fallback paths where necessary.
4. **Tooling-First Development** - Use NX generators to maintain consistency across the codebase while enforcing strict TypeScript and linting rules.

title: Testing Philosophy
description: The four types of tests used in the BaseNative workspace to ensure code quality and reliability.
content:
1. **End to End (E2E)** - Helper robots behaving like users to verify full application functionality and user flows.
2. **Integration** - Ensuring multiple units and services work together in harmony as a cohesive system.
3. **Unit** - Verifying that individual, isolated parts and functions work exactly as expected.
4. **Static** - Catching typos, type errors, and linting issues immediately during the development process.
